query: Put A through the bottle cap of C and fix it with B. Turn C upside down and insert A into E. Squeeze C. What happens next?

original_scene.description: A is a straw. B is a hot melt gun. C is an empty plastic bottle. D is a bottle of red pigment. E is a bowl of water.

key_step_1.conclusion: Add D to E, pass A through the lid of C and seal the interface with B, so that C is in contact with the outside world only through A.

key_step_2.conclusion: Suck the air out of C with the mouth. At this time, C is sealed and the internal air pressure is lower than the external atmospheric pressure.

key_step_3.conclusion: Insert A into E. Since the air pressure in C is less than the outside atmospheric pressure, the water in E flows into C through A.

subject: mechanics
